alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 3:51PM EST until January 11 at 12:09AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Philadelphia affecting Montgomery and Philadelphia Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Schuylkill River at Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 10.4 feet, Kelly Drive is flooded and closed between North Ferry Road and Falls Bridge. At 11.0 feet, Kelly Drive is flooded and closed between Hunting Park Avenue and Falls Bridge. The Flat Rock area is flooded. At 11.5 feet, Route 1 off ramp to Ridge Avenue is flooded and closed. MLK Drive is flooded and closed between Greenland Drive and Montgomery Drive. At 12.0 feet, Main Street in Manayunk floods in the area of Shurs Lane. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 PM EST Wednesday was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 03/11/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Philadelphia 11.0 11.1 Wed 3 pm 8.6 7.8 Crested & Falling &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1215 AM EST.
